contextId.information: Possible meanings are that God's hand represents 1) his guidance, 2) his power, or 3) his protection. AT: "guide me" or "make me prosper" or "protect me." It can also be translated more generally as "be with me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: your hand will be with me

contextId.information: The soldiers are described as skilled in warfare by the weapons they carried. AT: "They were all trained to fight well in battles." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] )
contextId.quote: who carried shield and sword, and who drew the bow

contextId.information: The authority of a person is described by where they stand. The right side of a person is the place where the person with the most authority stood. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: who stood at his right hand

contextId.information: AT: "who rules from between the statues of winged creatures on the ark of the covenant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: who sits enthroned over the cherubim

contextId.information: AT: "to celebrate as the Levites carry the ark" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: to bring up the ark

contextId.information: AT: "we did not ask him for instructions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: we did not seek him

contextId.information: AT: "Remember the covenant of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Keep his covenant in mind

contextId.information: "he deserves or he is worthy to receive" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: due to his name

contextId.information: David's job as a shepherd is referred to by the place he watched his sheep. AT: "I took you from your job as a shepherd" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I took you from the pasture

contextId.information: This phrase refers to death as a place where David's ancestors are because they are already dead. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: go to your fathers

contextId.information: The right to rule as king is described by the place where a king sits. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I will establish his throne

contextId.information: A king's right to rule is referred to by the place a king sits. AT: "and his right to rule" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: and his throne

contextId.information: "he sent some messengers to encourage them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: he sent to meet with them

contextId.information: "the Arameans understood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the Arameans saw

contextId.information: The people are referred to by their city. AT: "David required all the peoples of the cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: David required all the cities of the people

contextId.information: David and his soldiers are referred to by the part of their bodies used to hold a sword. AT: "David and his soldiers killed the descendants of the Rephaim" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: they were killed by the hand of David and by the hand of his soldiers

contextId.information: AT: "Let me come under the control of Yahweh, rather than under the control of people, for Yahweh is very merciful." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Let me fall into the hand of Yahweh rather than into the hand of man, for his merciful actions are very great

contextId.information: To change a decision. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: changed his mind

contextId.information: AT: "ready to attack" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: having a drawn sword in his hand

contextId.information: AT: "afraid he would be killed by the angel of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: afraid of the sword of the angel of Yahweh

contextId.information: "commanded laborers to build ... my plan was to hire laborers to build" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: commanded him to build ... my intention to build

contextId.information: AT: "a temple to honor me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: a house for my name

contextId.information: AT: "May you succeed in directing the building" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: May you build

contextId.information: "because I want to be honest and honorable in everything I do for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: in the uprightness of my heart
